actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 153.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Mann moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution. H. Res. 153 — "Expressing condolences to the families, friends, and loved ones of the victims of the crash of American Eagle Flight 5342 and PAT 25, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 758.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 758 — "To direct the United States Postal Service to issue regulations requiring Postal Service employees and contractors to report to the Postal Service traffic crashes involving vehicles carrying mail that result in injury or death, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 856.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 856 — "To require the Director of the Office of Management and Budget conduct a review to determine the impact of the lowest price technically acceptable source selection process on national security, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 872.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 872 — "To require covered contractors implement a vulnerability disclosure policy consistent with NIST guidelines, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1515.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Comer moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1515 — "To increase access to agency guidance documents."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 3.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

The House received a message from the Clerk. Under Clause 2(g) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk notified the House of his designation of Ms. Michelle H. Reinshuttle, Deputy Clerk, and Ms. Sarah Meier, Legal Counsel, to sign any and all papers and perform all other acts for him under the name of the Clerk of the House for which they would be authorized to do by virtue of the designation, except such as are provided by statute, in case of his temporary absence or disability and that this designation shall remain in effect for the 119th Congress, or until modified by him.

The House received a message from the Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk notified the House that he had received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on February 27, 2025, at 3:50 p.m.: That the Senate passed H.J. Res. 35. Appointments: United States Senate Caucus on International Narcotics Control and Board of Trustees of the John C. Stennis Center for Public Service Training and Development.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Kennedy of UT to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of March 3.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Pete Stauber to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
